My situation was similar. But my starting point may be different than everyone here so I was able to receover 0.4.0 working with CUDA. Just want to tell it for reference. I was having pytorch 0.4.0 working well with cuda (since its release) (I didn't use GPU when I was using 0.3.1. Only when I installed 0.4.0 I decided to invest a GPU)

Curerently, from nvcc --version:

Cuda compilation tools, release 9.2, V9.2.88

From nvidia-smi:

NVIDIA-SMI 390.67                 Driver Version: 390.67

Then a week ago, I was force to reinstall conda by another incident. Then with fresh installed conda, I install pytorch (Sep 2018) by (from pytorch.org)

conda install pytorch torchvision cuda92 -c pytorch

It installs pytorch 0.4.1py36_cuda9.2.148_cudnn7.1.4_1 and I was hit with the same error everyone here has.

I then remove it and install 0.4.0 by

conda install pytorch=0.4.0

It installs 0.4.0 and my old code works on GPU again.

So, whatever it is, it may not happen only going from 0.3.1 to 0.4.0 but also going from 0.4.0 to 0.4.1.

body:
My situation was similar. But my starting point may be different than everyone here so I was able to receover `0.4.0` working with CUDA. Just want to tell it for reference. I was having pytorch 0.4.0 working well with cuda (since its release) (I didn't use GPU when I was using 0.3.1. Only when I installed 0.4.0 I decided to invest a GPU)

Curerently, from `nvcc --version`:
```
Cuda compilation tools, release 9.2, V9.2.88
```
From `nvidia-smi`:
```
NVIDIA-SMI 390.67                 Driver Version: 390.67                    
```
Then a week ago, I was force to reinstall conda by another incident. Then with fresh installed conda, I install pytorch (Sep 2018) by (from [pytorch.org](pytorch.org))
```
conda install pytorch torchvision cuda92 -c pytorch
```
It installs pytorch `0.4.1py36_cuda9.2.148_cudnn7.1.4_1` and I was hit with the same error everyone here has.

I then remove it and install `0.4.0` by
```
conda install pytorch=0.4.0
```
It installs `0.4.0` and my old code works on GPU again.

So, whatever it is, it may not happen only going from `0.3.1` to `0.4.0` but also going from `0.4.0` to `0.4.1`.
